docs.lead_paragraph: The death of Governor MARCY appears to have been occasioned by heart disease. The Albany Atlas of yesterday states that he visited Albany on Friday, and was then apparently in excellent health and buoyant spirits. It was only within a short time of his death that he became conscious of a palpitation of the heart, and the symptoms of that disorder had not been such as to occasion alarmto himself or his friends.

docs.lead_paragraph: COW PENS AND COWS' MILK.--The resolution adopted one week ago in the Brooklyn Common Council, authorizing the erection of cow-stables recently destroyed by fire in the Seventh Ward, was last evening reconsidered and referred to the Health Committee for report next Monday evening.

headline.main: ADDITIONAL FROM EUROPE.; Completion of the Alternations to the Niagara-Trip from Portsmouth to Liverpool- Festivities, Speeches, &c.- Commencement of Shipping the Wire--The Salpment on the Agamemnon, &c., &c. Progress of the Atlantic Telegraph Enterprise.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have very little time for making up our correspondence, so completely overwhelmed with company have we been since our arrival in England. There is no cessation of visitors, and as the duties of the ship must, under all circumstances, be attended to, we have hardly time even for sleep. Our Captain is indefatigable, and few younger men would go through what he has gone through, and come out of it as fresh.

byline.original: ON BOARD THE UNITED STATES FRIGATE NIAGARA

docs.lead_paragraph: Letters received by the Niagara from Mrs. CRAWFORD confirm the previous encouraging accounts of the sculptor's health. So much has it improved, that his friends in London entertain strong hopes of his recovery. Nothing certain can, of course, be known until the tumor is entirely removed. Dr. FELL repeats his assurance that if the brain be not found diseased, CRAWFORD can recover, and that the...

headline.main: A Proposition for the Public Health. the Editor of the New-York Daily Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Those who are acquainted with our Dispensary system, and the operations of the visiting physicians attached to them, are aware that in their visits from house to house they frequently meet pools of filth and garbage, to say nothing of other breeders of dis ease and fateners of epidemics, stored away frombasement to attio, arising from imperfect drainage,

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. WILLIAM L. MARCY, late Secretary of -State, was found dead in his room on Saturday, the 4th. The cause of his death is not yet deter mined, and he appeared to be in his usual good health in the morning. It is expected that his funeral will take place at Albany, on Wednesday,on which occasion there will be a military display.

docs.lead_paragraph: A brief telegraphic announcement conveys to us the intelligence of the sudden death of one of the most eminent statesmen of New York, WILLIAM L. MARCY was found dead in his room, in Ballston, on the morning of the Fourth, to which he had retired apparently in the enjoyment of his usual health.
